intro: Arthroclianthus microbotrys, commonly known as the small-leaved arthroclianthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
